epd_metadata.epd_owner_address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.epd_produced_by_address: Level 3, Greenhouse, 180 George Street, Sydney NSW 2000 Australia
epd_metadata.epd_process_certified_by_address: Suite 2600, 101 Marietta St NW, Atlanta, Georgia 30303, USA
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_use: General use concrete including footpaths, slabs, foundations, normal class concrete
product_description.hazardous_substances: None listed in Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern (SVHC) exceeding 0.1%
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging
product_description.classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D
lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified (scope is cradle to delivery)

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m3 of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered without packaging except packaging of materials

data_quality.assessment: Good or very good geographic and temporal representativeness
data_quality.background_data_timeliness: All updated within 10 years as required under PCR 2019:14

installation.assumptions: Based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool
installation.activities_included: Pouring concrete from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation site work and forms

end_of_life.control: No control by Holcim over end-of-life fate

deconstruction.method: Physical drilling and removal using hydraulic excavator

benefits_and_loads_beyond_system_boundar.recycled_aggregate_use: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

targets.2030: Embodied carbon of all construction materials to be at least 40% lower
targets.2050: All new construction materials to be net zero

carbonation.description: Natural process of CO2 absorption by concrete over its lifetime, partially offsetting cement manufacturing emissions
carbonation.note: CO2 absorption not considered in this EPD and not reflected in results

allocation_approach.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_approach.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically due to significant economic value
allocation_approach.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes
recycled_materials_handling.conformance: AusLCI dataset conforms to EN 15804 when applying allocation

notes.use_of_results_warning: Use of results of modules A1-A3 or A4-A5 without considering module C may mislead communication and decision-making.
notes.results_nature: Estimated impact results are relative statements and do not indicate endpoints, thresholds, safety margins, or risks.
disclaimers: Some impact indicators have high uncertainties or limited experience.
Ionizing radiation indicator excludes nuclear accidents, occupational exposure, and radioactive waste disposal effects.

references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative Guidelines (2023)
British Standards Institution BS EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and BS EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions and PCR2019:14 V1.3.4 (2024)
Man Yu et al., Procedia Engineering, 2017

contact_information.company_address: Level 40/100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia

additional_info.disclaimer: This publication provides general information only and is no substitute for professional technical engineering advice. Holcim accepts no liability for loss or damage resulting from reliance on this information.
